00006 #define SERVADDR    "127.0.0.1"     /* default server address   */
00007 
00008 #define DEF_XFER_PORT   3001            /* default transport socket */
00009 #define DEF_MAX_PORTS   64          /* max open transport sockets   */
00010 #define DEF_NTHREADS    10      /* default threads to create    */
00011 #define MAX_THREADS 512     /* max transfer threads to run  */
00012 #define MAXTRIES    128     /* max times to resend      */
00013 
00014 #define DO_CHECKSUMS    0       /* debug flags          */
00015

00017 #define PS_DEST     1       /* data sink            */
00018 
00019 #define PS_PUSH     XFER_PUSH   /* push transfer model      */
00020 #define PS_PULL     XFER_PULL   /* pull transfer model      */

00025 #define TCP_WINDOW_MAX  196608      /* TCP window max size      */
00026 /*#define TCP_WINDOW_SZ (1024 *   8)    // TCP window size (  8kb)  */

00028 /*#define TCP_WINDOW_SZ (1024 *  32)    // TCP window size ( 32kb)  */

00031 #define TCP_WINDOW_SZ   262144

00050 /*  Packet header.  A data "stripe" is preceeded by a header packet 
00051 **  containing information about the stripe.  This is also used when
00052 **  doing checksums after transferring each stripe.
00053 */
00054 typedef struct {
00055     unsigned short  sum16;      /* 16-bit checksum      */
00056     unsigned int    sum32;      /* 32-bit checksum      */
00057     int         chunkSize;      /* transfer 'chunk' size    */
00058     long        offset;     /* file offset of stripe    */
00059     long        maxbytes;       /* max bytes to transfer    */
00060 } phdr, *phdrP;
00061 
00062     
00063 /*  Data structure used to pass information into parallel socket worker
00064 **  thread.
00065 */
00066 typedef struct {
00067     char     fname[256];        /* file name            */
00068     char     dir[256];          /* working directory        */
00069     long     fsize;         /* file size            */
00070 
00071     char     host[256];         /* remote host name     */
00072     int      port;          /* remote port number       */
00073     int      mode;          /* push or pull mode        */
00074 
00075     int      tnum;          /* processing thread number */
00076     int      rate;          /* UDT transfer rate        */
00077     long     nbytes;            /* number of bytes to transfer  */
00078     long     start;         /* start byte number        */
00079     long     end;           /* ending byte number       */
00080 } psArg, *psArgP;

00090 int     psSpawnThreads (void *worker, int nthreads, char *dir, char *fname,

00092             int verbose, pthread_t *tids);
00093 int    *psCollectThreads (int nthreads, pthread_t *tids);

00096 void    psReceiveFile (void *data);
